Physics (Mechanics).question: A particle moves with uniform acceleration along a straight line from rest. The percentage increase in displacement during sixth second compared to that in fifth second is about

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: If two miscible liquids of same volume but different densities PI and P2 are mixed, then the density of the mixture is given by

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The position vector of a particle is r = 2t2xˆ +3tyˆ +4zˆ . Then the instantaneous velocity v and acceleration a respectively lie

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: Two persons are holding a rope of negligible mass horizontally. A 20 kg mass is attached to the rope at the midpoint; as a result the rope deviates from the horizontal direction. The tension required to completely straighten the rope is (g = 10 m /s2)
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Let T be the tension in the rope: 2Tcosθ = mg. Where θ = 90°, T = mg/2cos90, cos90 = 0. So = mg/0 = ∞, T = ∞ Hence tension will be infinite.

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: Which one of the following does not convert electrical energy into light energy?
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: The heat from the wick melts the wax which gets absorbed in the wick and then gets burnt (which is really oxidation) to produce heat energy as well as light energy.

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: The visible portion of the electromagnetic spectrum is
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: The visible spectrum is the portion of the electromagnetic spectrum that is visible to the human eye. Electromagnetic radiation in this range of wavelengths is called visible light or simply light. A typical human eye will respond to wavelengths from about 380 to 740 nanometers.

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: The direction of magnetic field at any location on the earth’s surface is commonly specified in terms of
options: both field declination and field inclination
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).answer: both field declination and field inclination
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: The direction of the magnetic field at any location on Earth’s surface is commonly specified in terms of two angles. The angle of the magnetic north relative to the true north is called the Declination or the Variation. When we are facing the Magnetic North, the angle that field makes with the Horizontal is called the Inclination or Magnetic dip.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: When a convex lens produces a real image of an object, the minimum distance between the object and image is equal to
options: the focal length of the convex lens
twice the focal length of the convex lens
four times the focal length of the convex lens
one half of the focal length of the convex lens
Physics (Optics).answer: four times the focal length of the convex lens
Physics (Optics).explanation: Let the distance between the object and its real image formed by a convex lens be d. Let the distance of the object from the lens be x, So the image distance from the lens is (d – x). Then x = (d±√(d^2–4fd))/2. For real value of x, d^2 ≥ 4fd, so d ≥ 4f. Therefore the minimum distance the objects and its real image formed by convex lens is 4f.

Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: In which of the following, heat loss is primarily not due to convection?
options: Circulation of air around blast furnace
Heating of glass surface of a bulb due to current in filament
Physics (Thermodynamics).answer: Heating of glass surface of a bulb due to current in filament
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: Convection is transfer of heat through more and in bulb transfer due to radiation.

Botany.subject: Botany
Botany.question: Which of the following is/are the main absorbing organ/ organs of plants?
Botany.explanation: Major Organs of most plants include roots, stems, and leaves. A root is a complex organ consisting of several types of tissue absorbing water and minerals: Thin-walled epidermal cells and root hairs are well suited to absorb water

Botany.subject: Botany
Botany.question: Which of the following is not a primary function of a green leaf?
Botany.explanation: The main function of a leaf is to produce food for the plant by photosynthesis. Chlorophyll, the substance that gives plants their characteristic green colour, absorbs light energy. Conduction of food and water is not the primary function of leaf. It is done by vascular bundles xylem and phloem which is present throughout the plant body.

Botany.subject: Botany
Botany.question: Which one of the following denotes a ‘true’ fruit?
options: When only the thalamus of the flower grows and develops into a fruit
When only the receptacle of the flower develops into a fruit
When fruit originates only from the calyx of a flower
When only the ovary of the flower grows into a fruit
Botany.answer: When only the ovary of the flower grows into a fruit
Botany.explanation: A true fruit or eucarp is a mature or ripened ovary, developed after fertilization, e.g., Mango, Maize, Grape etc.

Botany.subject: Botany
Botany.question: In which one of the following physiological processes, excess water escapes in the form of droplets from a plant?
Botany.explanation: Guttation is the process of secreting water droplets from the pores of some vascular plants like grass. Guttation is often confused with dew droplets that condense from the atmosphere on to the plants surface.

Botany.subject: Botany
Botany.question: If the xylem of a plant is mechanically blocked, which of the following functions of the plant will be affected?
Botany.explanation: Xylem is water conducting tissue in plants. If the Xylem of the plants is removed, upward movement of the water and transportation of solutes will stop leading to wilting of leaves and ultimately cause the death of plants.

Botany.subject: Botany
Botany.question: Which one of the following agents does not contribute to propagation of plants through seed dispersal?
Botany.explanation: Seed dispersal is the movement or transport of seeds away from the parent plant. Plants have very limited mobility and consequently rely upon a variety of dispersal vectors to transport their propagules, including both abiotic vectors such as the wind and water and living (biotic) vectors like birds and animals.

Botany.subject: Botany
Botany.question: Which one of the following features is an indication for modification of stem of a plant?
Botany.explanation: Potatoes are called as modified stems because it possess many qualification which is of stem . Potatoes are underground stem .and usually called as tubers . They are called as modified stem because as it has scaly leaves, it has nodes, internodes, buds and adventitious roots.

Ecology.subject: Ecology
Ecology.question: Which one of the following statements with regard to growth of coral reefs is not correct?
options: Coral can grow abundantly in freshwater.
It requires shallow saltwater, not deeper than 50 metres.
It requires plenty of sunlight to aid photosynthesis
Ecology.answer: Coral can grow abundantly in freshwater.
Ecology.explanation: Corals need saltwater to survive and require a certain balance in the ratio of salt to water. This is why corals don’t live in areas where rivers drain fresh water into the ocean.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question: Which of the following roles is/ are played by epididymis, vas deferens, seminal vesicles and prostate in male reproductive system of human?
Human Physiology.explanation: In humans, the most important male androgen is testosterone. Several accessory organs and ducts aid the process of sperm maturation and transport the sperm and other seminal components to the penis, which delivers sperm to the female reproductive tract.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question: Which one of the following is the special type of milk produced by a lactating mother, essential for the development of immune response of newborn baby in human?
options: Breast milk produced after a month of childbirth
Human Physiology.explanation: Colostrum is the first form of milk produced by the mammary glands immediately following delivery of the newborn. Colostrum is known to contain immune cells (as lymphocytes) and many antibodies such as IgA, IgG, and IgM. These are some of the components of adaptive immune system.

Genetics.subject: Genetics
Genetics.question: Which one of the following statements explains higher mutation rate and faster evolution found in RNA virus?
options: RNA is relatively unstable compared to DNA.
Virus can multiply only within the living cell of a host.
Metabolic processes are absent in virus.
Virus can remain latent for a long period.
Genetics.answer: RNA is relatively unstable compared to DNA.
Genetics.explanation: Adaptive Value of High Mutation Rates of RNA Viruses: Separating Causes from Consequences. As a consequence of the lack of proofreading activity of RNA virus polymerases, new viral genetic variants are constantly created. RNA viruses readily adapt to changing environmental conditions.
